Package battleship

Class Sea

java.lang.Object
battleship.Sea
public class Sea extends Object
The Sea class represents the game board for the battleship game.

    • display

      public void display(boolean isDefender)
      display the game board line by line and cell by cell, on standard output, the display is different for the defender or the attacker, according to parameter
      Parameters:
      isDefender - true if display is for defender, false if for opponent

    • testIfShipCanBePlaced

      public void testIfShipCanBePlaced(Ship shipToPlace, Position position, int dx, int dy) throws IllegalStateException
      Try if the ship can be placed
      Parameters:
      shipToPlace - the ship to add
      position - the position of the cells
      dx - Vertical position
      dy - Horizontal position
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the ship can not be placed on the sea : return exception

    • addShip

      public void addShip(Ship shipToPlace, Position position, int dx, int dy) throws IllegalStateException
      Add the ship to the game board at the specified position
      Parameters:
      shipToPlace - The ship to add to the board
      position - the position where the ship should be placed
      dx - Vertical position
      dy - Horizontal position
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the ship can not be placed on the sea

    • addShipVertically

      public void addShipVertically(Ship shipToPlace, Position position) throws IllegalStateException

      Parameters:
      shipToPlace - The ship to add in the board
      position - The position in the board
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the ship can not be placed on the sea
